summary:
The Kingdom of France was a powerful European nation from the Middle Ages until the 19th century. It started as a part of the Carolingian Empire and became a strong, centralized monarchy. Kings like Philip II and Louis XIV ruled, and France had colonies in Asia, Africa, and the Americas.

Over time, France fought many wars, including the Hundred Years' War and the Italian Wars. It also faced internal conflicts like the Wars of Religion. After the French Revolution (1789), the kingdom ended and was replaced by a republic in 1792. The monarchy returned briefly but ended in 1848.
title: Kingdom of France
